intro: Maughania vestita, commonly known as the naked maughania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Maughania vestita is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
